@InsightRh For sure. There is no mechanism that solves every edge case and problem! You just hope each experiment leads us closer to a better, more scalable NFT ecosystem :)
@V1Zhual @m0rd_fustang @_ZenoDaGod üòÇ

@InsightRh Oh I'm not being prescriptive on %s or categories! I'm giving an example of what projects can decide to do. This is simply a tool, part of a long set of mechanisms to help bootstrap early ecosystems.
@InsightRh https://t.co/4pnhNQkhrx

@InsightRh That is a very real risk that you'd balance out with moderation. 

For example, out of a 10k project, one possibility:
- 30% allocated to any wallet, but you need to first go through a free NFT security class
- 50% to allow listed wallets via community
- 20% to high hodler scores
And @BrennerSpear is building something here https://t.co/0g8J3aJI95
@BrennerSpear That is right! How did I forget @BrennerSpear
And we can write contracts that allow list different categories with different mint limits, so you can balance giving newbies access while still maintaining a health community.

We need on-chain verifiable wallet scoring. 

Enables artists/projects to allow list wallets that have:
- gone through an NFT security class
- been active with NFTs for more than 3 months
- been holding a top tier NFT
- not engaged in excessive flip behavior
@V1Zhual üíéüëã aka the ‚Äú@richerd index‚Äù

We need wallet scores, based on an accumulated history of good actions. Reward hodlers, ecosystem participants that have verifiable on chain activity.

Who is building this? https://t.co/LbPWeQ7nUW

@joshqharris I‚Äôve made a lot of assumptions based on your original tweet ofc, so let me know if those are wrong. 

The biggest concern I have is aiming to make a collection ‚Äúgo viral‚Äù after 24 hours of building and the origination not from the team that will carry it long term.

@joshqharris I hope people / teams that launch NFT collections stick with it long-term. Projects that are built by an third party team (ie not sticking around) and ‚Äúgo viral‚Äù have a high likelihood the average collector.
@lphaCentauriKid https://t.co/u3TgdsXjn3

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots Hey man, I have tremendous respect for you, and I'm not sure where the conversation devolved to where you feel insulted.

You sound very passionate on this topic and I respect that. Maybe we can have a call to discuss? Or just consider it differing opinions.

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots Isn't the point here the entirety of the argument around artist choice?

You compare a future custodian making a decision for a piece of history VS an artist making a decision around his art. It's treating the art more as an object of value rather than an expression of the artist

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots WMVG collectors have gotten access to Drift's edition work, his Nifty Gateway releases, and in the future much more of his life journey.

You get there from being part of the journey, not holding out because you're trying to close some arbitrage.

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots This is a tough statement to agree with, because it shows so little faith in the artist's ability to bring value to collectors. The follow up tweet treats every piece as a commodity.

If Drift stopped working today and if each piece were the same, then you would be 100% correct.
@yungwknd @ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots üíØ

@ethereumdegen @yungwknd @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots You're absolutely right. Artists are not in control of their tokens. They control journey of their art, and what the future of their art looks like. 

And it isn't black and white, just as @muratpak makes creations that ask us to question the nature of ownership and creation.

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots I'm not here to speak for Drift, and FWIW there's been regular discussion. I'm just speaking from my own opinions on this topic. 

Personally I think wrapping is great for collectibles, I think it's not a strong statement for art. Regardless it is however a choice by the artist.

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots Sure, and again -- I get that. I'm sure there are collectors that feel that way, just as I'm sure the best artists are saying to their collectors: "Trust me and my art".

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots Ultimately the discussion around losing the peg on a collection treats the artwork as commodity - that there would be collectors that disregard the intention of the artist, in search of value from holding the last few pieces that aren't migrated.

@ethereumdegen @PopWonderNFT @DrifterShoots Nothing but respect for you @ethereumdegen. 

I think the question here is artist choice. And the choice here is one made around ownership. If it were a temporary measure, nothing would be risked -- and the act of wrapping it would make the ownership decision almost meaningless.

Huge thanks to @pepperonick on building a fantastic dapp, @0x5e5e on a gorgeous design, and smart contract review by @richerd, @yungwknd, and @emo_eth to make me less nervous about this contract deploying
